# Earnings call transcript: Microsoft reports Q4 2025 earnings beat, stock rises

[Transcripts](https://www.investing.com/news/transcripts)

Published 07/30/2025, 07:40 PM

Earnings call transcript: Microsoft reports Q4 2025 earnings beat, stock rises

[View all comments (0)0](https://www.investing.com/www.investing.com#comments-4161549)

© Reuters.

[MSFT\
\
2.36%](https://www.investing.com/equities/microsoft-corp)

Microsoft Corporation’s fourth-quarter earnings for fiscal year 2025 exceeded Wall Street expectations, driven by strong growth in its cloud and AI businesses. The company reported earnings per share (EPS) of $3.65, surpassing the forecast of $3.37. Revenue reached $76.4 billion, beating estimates of $73.79 billion. With a market capitalization of $3.8 trillion, Microsoft continues to trade near its 52-week high of $518.29. Following the announcement, Microsoft’s stock rose 0.29% in regular trading and gained an additional 0.47% in aftermarket trading, reaching $515. Accor

## Summary

- Microsoft Corporation's latest earnings report shows robust growth, especially in Azure and Office.
- Despite a P/E of ~33x, MSFT’s current valuation is fair when adjusted for its fundamental growth and profitability potential.
- Rising CAPEX is concerning, and CAPEX demand has outpaced cash flow growth by a wide margin in recent quarters.
- But the pressure on MSFT should be manageable and temporary only.

metadata.title: What will the first reported earnings per share after September 2025 be for the following companies? (MSFT)
metadata.description:
[Earnings per share](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/e/eps.asp) (EPS) is a financial metric that measures a company's profit per outstanding share of common stock. It's calculated by dividing a company's net income by its total number of outstanding shares. EPS is considered one of the most important variables in determining a stock's value and is commonly used by investors to assess a company's profitability.

As of early October 2025, Apple, Nvidia, Microsoft, Amazon, AMD, Tesla, and Meta are among the largest companies [by market cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/) in the world. Their EPS in the last four quarters have been:

* [Apple](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/aapl/apple/eps-earnings-per-share-diluted): \$0.97, \$2.40, \$1.65, \$1.57
* [AMD](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/amd/amd/eps-earnings-per-share-diluted): \$0.47, \$0.30, \$0.44, \$0.54
* [Amazon](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/amzn/amazon/eps-earnings-per-share-diluted): \$1.43, \$1.86, \$1.59, \$1.68
* [Meta](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/meta/meta-platforms/eps-earnings-per-share-diluted): \$6.03, \$7.96, \$6.43, \$7.14
* [Microsoft](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/msft/microsoft/eps-earnings-per-share-diluted): \$3.30, \$3.23, \$3.46, \$3.65
* [Nvidia](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/nvda/nvidia/eps-earnings-per-share-diluted): \$0.78, \$0.89, \$0.75, \$1.08
* [Tesla](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/tsla/tesla/eps-earnings-per-share-diluted):  \$0.62, \$0.59, \$0.12, \$0.33

\[Subquestions on more of the above companies will be added throughout the quarter.]

`{"format":"metac_reveal_and_close_in_period","info":{"post_id":40230,"question_id":39770}}`
metadata.resolution_criteria:
This question is a subquestion of a group question. This subquestion specifically targets the option 'MSFT'. The resolution criteria for the parent question is below. 

Each subquestion will resolve as the GAAP diluted EPS reported in each company's first official quarterly earnings release after September 30, 2025. This is expected to be

* the Q3 FY2025 report for Apple (released around October 30)
* the Q2 FY2025 report for AMD (released November 5)
* the Q2 FY2025 report for Amazon (released November 4)
* the Q2 FY2025 report for Meta (released October 29)
* the Q4 FY2025 report for Microsoft (released October 29)
* the Q2 FY2026 report for Nvidia (released November 19)
* the Q2 FY2025 report for Tesla (released October 22)

The earnings reports are typically released on the respective companies' investor relations websites and filed with the [U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC)](https://www.sec.gov/search-filings) as a Form 8-K.
metadata.fine_print:
* If multiple earnings reports are released, the first report encompassing the entirety of the previous quarter will be used.
* Only the initially reported figures will be considered—any subsequent revisions, corrections, or restatements will not affect resolution.
* If a company does not publicly report earnings after September 30, 2025 and before January 1, 2026 or if it ceases to operate, that specific subquestion will be **annulled**.
* If a company announces a stock split, the reported EPS figure will be adjusted to reflect pre-split values.
